solution_line_template: First figure out how many square feet the original bolt of fabric was: {bolt_length} feet * {bolt_width} feet = <<{bolt_length}*{bolt_width}={bolt_area}>>{bolt_area} square feet
Then figure out how much fabric Ann took for the living room curtains: {living_length} feet * {living_width} feet = <<{living_length}*{living_width}={living_area}>>{living_area} square feet
Then figure out how much fabric Ann took for the bathroom curtains: {bedroom_length} feet * {bedroom_width} feet = <<{bedroom_length}*{bedroom_width}={bedroom_area}>>{bedroom_area} square feet

Finally, subtract the square footage of both sets of curtains from the total square footage: {bolt_area} - {living_area} - {bedroom_area} = <<{bolt_area}-{living_area}-{bedroom_area}={fabric_left}>>{fabric_left} square feet
